references.reason: This paper introduces the Convergent Cross Mapping (CCM) method, a core concept that the current paper builds upon and improves.
Takens' Theorem, a cornerstone of nonlinear time series analysis, underpins the theoretical foundation of the CCM method and the current paper's TSCI approach.
This paper provides crucial theoretical background on delay embedding and its properties which are essential for the CCM technique and the proposed TSCI method.
The book provides a comprehensive treatment of dynamical systems theory, which is essential for understanding the theoretical basis behind the method.
This paper offers a significant overview of causal discovery methods and associated concepts, which forms part of the theoretical background used in the development of TSCI.
